wikipedia_page.main: Major-General Henry Charles Hovell-Thurlow-Cumming-Bruce, 7th Baron Thurlow,  (29 May 1910 – 29 May 1971), was a British peer and British Army officer.

response: The brigade remained in England for most of the war, before crossing the channel to fight in Normandy as part of Operation Overlord on 13 June 1944, a week after D-Day on 6 June. The brigade was now commanded by Brigadier Henry Hovell-Thurlow-Cumming-Bruce, 7th Baron Thurlow.
